intro: Meriania albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered meriania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its attractive, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat. Meriania albiflora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various soil conditions.
